title: Music-Based Early Childhood English Instructional Design Strategy Workshop: Integration of Scientific Inquiry and Language Acquisition

context.prior_knowledge: Basic educational knowledge, understanding of English pronunciation, fundamental concepts of scientific inquiry methods and variable control
context.additional_context: A course for pre-service teachers to acquire practical lesson design skills combining musical elements with English learning. It emphasizes developing teaching strategies based on neuroscience research and methods for collecting educational evidence.

learning_goals: Design three educational activities for young children that integrate music rhythm and melody to teach English vocabulary and sentence structures (applying scientific observation and experimental methods).
Cultivate the ability to explain the connection between music and language acquisition based on brain-based learning theories (integrating neuroscientific evidence and variable analysis).
Create and implement instructional materials using digital audio/video editing tools in a BYOD environment, including data collection methods for measuring educational effectiveness.

resources: Sample Early Childhood English Teaching Materials

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
